intro: Pleroma heteromallum, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Pleroma heteromallum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant color and unique floral structure.
